title: Verbal Memory Performance and Completion of Cardiac Rehabilitation in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease
display_name: Verbal Memory Performance and Completion of Cardiac Rehabilitation in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease

raw_affiliation_strings: Departments of Pharmacology & Toxicology (W.S., M.S., K.L.L.), Rehabilitation (S.M., P.I.O., K.L.L.), and Psychiatry (N.H., K.L.L.), University of Toronto
Dr Lanctôt had full access to all of the data in the study and takes responsibility for the integrity of the data and the accuracy of the data analysis.

From the Neuropsychopharmacology Research Group (W.S., N.H., M.S., J.C., K.L.L.) and the Departments of Psychiatry (N.H., K.L.L.), Clinical Pharmacology (P.I.O.), Clinical Epidemiology (A.K.), and Neuropsychology (P.S.), Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre
Received for publication December 6, 2010

The study was supported by research grants from The Drummond Foundation (Montréal, Québec, Canada), the Physicians' Services Incorporated Foundation (Toronto, Ontario, Canada), the Heart and Stroke Foundation (Toronto, Ontario, Canada), and the Alzheimer Society of Canada (Toronto, Ontario, Canada). The aforementioned institutions financially supported the study, but they were not involved in study management, the collection, analysisand interpretation of data, and the preparation of the article and article review or approval.
and Cardiac Rehabilitation Program (S.M., P.I.O.), Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
revision received May 13, 2011.
